page.title: 01General Area
page.content: We are at the end of the Beechwoods of the Chiltern range of hills.THe area is densely wooded with a few small farms scattered over a clay with flint terrain.The drainage of the area is southwards towards the River Thames.Woodcote is the largest community and is still developing with many new houses which are expensive and not many of the "local inhabitants" remain.Many people commute to Reading or Oxford for their work.The main A4074 links Wallingford to Reading and is an important roadway north of the river. There is no railway.The Oratory school covers a large area and employs many local people.It is a private school which backs on to the playing fields of a primary and comprehensive campus. A bus company is centred on Woodcote.
